intro: Chisocheton multijugis, commonly known as the multi-jugate chisocheton, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with multiple leaflets and small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
